title: Unit 2: Definition and Fundamental Properties of Differentiation
subtitle: Understanding How Things Change Instantly
description: Master the power of instantaneous rates of change.
objectives: Understand how to find the slope of a curve using derivatives, including vertical tangents and points with no tangent.
Use tangent lines for local linear approximations and to model real-world behavior.
Learn the definition of a derivative using limits and difference quotients.
Master rules for finding derivatives: Power Rule, Sum/Difference, Constant, Product, Quotient, Chain Rule, and more.
Differentiate trigonometric functions like sin(x), cos(x), and other advanced functions.
Apply derivatives to calculate velocity, acceleration, and rates of change in real-world scenarios.
Estimate and interpret rate of change using graphs, tables, and equations.
Translate between real-life descriptions and equations involving derivatives.
bigIdeas: Derivatives tell us how fast something is changing at an exact moment—like speed at an instant.
Rules and limits help us simplify how we find those rates of change across different functions.
If a derivative is positive, the original function is increasing—helpful in understanding trends.
You can use derivatives to model real-world problems, like education spending or motion.
Recognizing patterns and applying the right rule makes complex differentiation easier.
Derivatives can become functions too—this helps us understand both the function and its behavior.
